content.description:
A Flagstaff classic for the grade, Split the Difference starts out at the large, deep tan hueco, below a subtle tan streak.  Move up from the hueco to an obvious slopey, slanty finger bucket directly above the Hueco. Another crimp, much less obvious than the first sits directly above by about a foot. Move out left to a deep three finger pocket, a few more good holds, and jugs at the top. 

  A classic for grade hands down. Tall, beautiful, a great top out, and a great landing. What are you all waiting for?

Measure Twice is the second line right of the tree.  Start by working your way up to the horizontal line of pockets.  Get established, and then do the big move up to the flat jug.  There are some good vertical pockets (kind of hard to see, but they are there).  Top her out.  Good clean fun.

Layout is to the right of Measure Twice, and left of Split the Difference.  Start out on pinchs, edges, and go up to a flat obvious pocket.  From there head up to square cut hold, crimps, and more pockets.  Up to the top...

Kickback takes the obvious line out the large tan streak just right of Split the Difference. Get up to the undercling heuco, move straight up to the butter dishes under the bulge. Move up past slopersÂ and razor cut crimps to a big finish. Takes the bulge straight on.

 If this doesn't get your heart beating, you might be dead.

pathTokens: Land of High Bouldering AKA The Ridge
Workshop and Widow Maker Walls, The

content.description: The Workshop wall is home to some of the finest moderate highballing in the area. The stone is nearly immaculate, the landings good, and the moves big. There are about 12 lines here ranging from okay, to super classic, and from V0 to V6ish. Though not extremely tall, these lines will get your heart pumping, as well as your forearms. You certainly won't want to fall to many times from the top, if ever.
